question: सकल घरेलू उत्पाद (GDP) क्या दर्शाता है? / What does Gross Domestic Product (GDP) represent?

options.A: एक देश में उत्पादन की कुल मूल्य / Total value of production within a country
options.B: एक देश के नागरिकों की आय / Income of citizens of a country
options.C: देश की कुल निर्यात मात्रा / Total exports of a country
options.D: देश की कुल आयात मात्रा / Total imports of a country

question: सकल राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद (GNP) में क्या शामिल होता है? / What is included in Gross National Product (GNP)?

options.A: देश के भीतर उत्पादन का मूल्य / Value of production inside the country
options.B: देश के नागरिकों द्वारा विदेशों में अर्जित आय / Income earned by nationals abroad
options.C: विदेशी नागरिकों द्वारा देश में अर्जित आय / Income earned by foreigners inside the country

question: नेट राष्ट्रीय उत्पाद (NNP) कैसे प्राप्त किया जाता है? / How is Net National Product (NNP) calculated?

options.A: GNP - depreciation (मूल्यह्रास)
options.B: GDP - depreciation
options.C: GNP + depreciation

question: राष्ट्रीय आय (National Income) किससे मापी जाती है? / National Income is measured by?

options.A: NNP at market price
options.B: NNP at factor cost
options.C: GDP at market price

question: मुद्रास्फीति (Inflation) का अर्थ क्या है? / What does Inflation mean?

options.A: सामान्य मूल्य स्तर में वृद्धि / Increase in general price level
options.B: सामान्य मूल्य स्तर में कमी / Decrease in general price level
options.C: बेरोजगारी में वृद्धि / Increase in unemployment
options.D: आयात में वृद्धि / Increase in imports

question: मुद्रास्फीति के मुख्य कारण क्या हैं? / What are the main causes of Inflation?

options.A: मांग बढ़ना (Demand-pull)
options.B: लागत बढ़ना (Cost-push)
options.C: सरकारी करों में कमी

question: मुद्रस्फीति दर भारत में 2024-25 के लिए अनुमानित है? / What is the estimated inflation rate for India in 2024-25?

options.A: लगभग 4-6%
options.B: लगभग 10-12%

question: मुद्रास्फीति के विपरीत, मूल्य स्तर में कमी को क्या कहते हैं? / What is the term for a decrease in price level, opposite of inflation?

options.A: डिफ्लेशन (Deflation)
options.B: स्टैगफ्लेशन (Stagflation)
options.C: रेसशन (Recession)

question: स्टैगफ्लेशन क्या है? / What is Stagflation?

options.A: मुद्रास्फीति और बेरोजगारी दोनों का बढ़ना / Increase in both inflation and unemployment
options.B: मुद्रास्फीति का तेजी से गिरना / Rapid fall in inflation
options.C: महँगाई में कमी और उत्पादन में वृद्धि / Decrease in prices and increase in production

question: भारत में हाल ही में स्टैगफ्लेशन की स्थिति कब देखी गई है? / When was the recent occurrence of stagflation observed in India?

options.A: 2022-23 के बीच महंगाई और बेरोजगारी बढ़ने पर
options.C: 1990 के दशक में

question: GDP aur GNP mein mukhya antar kya hai? / What is the main difference between GDP and GNP?

options.A: GDP desh ke andar utpadan ko maapta hai, GNP desh ke nagrikon ki aay ko maapta hai / GDP measures production within the country; GNP measures income of nationals
options.B: GDP mein depreciation shamil hota hai, GNP mein nahi / GDP includes depreciation, GNP does not
options.C: GNP mein foreign income shamil hoti hai, GDP mein nahi / GNP includes foreign income, GDP does not
options.D: GDP hamesha GNP se bada hota hai / GDP is always bigger than GNP

question: Net Domestic Product (NDP) ka arth kya hai? / What is the meaning of Net Domestic Product (NDP)?

options.A: GDP minus depreciation
options.B: GNP minus depreciation
options.C: Total national income

question: 2024-25 mein India ki estimated GDP growth rate kitni hai? / What is the estimated GDP growth rate of India in 2024-25?
MPC (Marginal Propensity to Consume) ka kya role hota hai? / What is the role of MPC (Marginal Propensity to Consume)?

options.A: Additional income ka kharch karne ki pravritti / Propensity to spend additional income
options.B: Additional income ko bachat karne ki pravritti / Propensity to save additional income
options.C: RBI ki monetary policy / RBI's monetary policy
options.D: Sarkari karon ki nirdharit dar / Government tax rate

question: Inflation ke kaun-kaun se prakar hote hain? / What are the types of inflation?

options.A: Demand-pull inflation
options.B: Cost-push inflation
options.C: Monetary inflation

question: Consumer Price Index (CPI) ka prayog kisliye kiya jata hai? / What is the Consumer Price Index (CPI) used for?

options.A: Muddra-sfiti maapne ke liye / To measure inflation
options.B: GDP nirdharit karne ke liye / To determine GDP
options.C: Rozgar dar jaanchne ke liye / To check employment rate
options.D: Niryat ki maatra maapne ke liye / To measure exports

question: Stagflation ke dauran kya sthiti hoti hai? / What is the situation during stagflation?

options.A: Uchit inflation aur uchit berozgari / High inflation and high unemployment
options.B: Neeche keemat aur adhik utpadan / Falling prices and higher production
options.C: Niche keemat aur uchit berozgari / Falling prices and high unemployment
options.D: Uchit keemat aur uchit berozgari / Stable prices and unemployment

question: Nominal GDP aur Real GDP mein kya antar hota hai? / What is the difference between Nominal GDP and Real GDP?

options.A: Nominal GDP current prices par aadharit hai, Real GDP base year prices par / Nominal GDP is based on current prices; Real GDP on base year prices
options.B: Nominal GDP inflation adjust karta hai, Real GDP nahi karta / Nominal GDP adjusts for inflation, Real GDP does not
options.C: Real GDP hamesha nominal GDP se zyada hota hai / Real GDP is always more than nominal GDP
options.D: Nominal GDP sirf agriculture ko maapta hai / Nominal GDP measures only agriculture

question: Deflation ke kya prabhav hote hain? / What are the effects of deflation?

options.A: Kharch mein kami / Reduction in spending
options.B: Udyog mein mandi / Decline in industry
options.C: Rozgar mein vriddhi / Increase in employment

question: India mein Consumer Price Index (CPI) kis kshetra ke liye mahatvapurna hai? / For which sector is the Consumer Price Index (CPI) important in India?

options.A: Gramin kshetra / Rural sector
options.B: Shehri kshetra / Urban sector
options.C: Samaan roop se dono / Both equally

question: GDP deflator ka use kisliye hota hai? / What is the use of GDP deflator?

options.A: Moolya star mein parivartan ko maapna / To measure changes in price level
options.B: GDP ki real value nikalne ke liye / To calculate real GDP
options.C: Berozgari dar nikalne ke liye / To find unemployment rate
options.D: Krishi utpadan badhane ke liye / To increase agricultural production

question: GNP aur NNP mein kya antar hai? / What is the difference between GNP and NNP?

options.A: NNP mein depreciation minus kiya jata hai / Depreciation is subtracted in NNP
options.B: GNP hamesha NNP se chhota hota hai / GNP is always smaller than NNP
options.C: GNP mein sirf domestic income shamil hai / GNP includes only domestic income
options.D: NNP mein sirf foreign income shamil hai / NNP includes only foreign income

question: 2024-25 ke liye India ki estimated inflation rate kya hai? / What is the estimated inflation rate for India in 2024-25?
Monetary policy ka inflation control mein kya role hota hai? / What role does monetary policy play in controlling inflation?

options.A: Interest rate badha kar demand kam karta hai / Increases interest rates to reduce demand
options.B: Sarkari kharch badha kar demand badhata hai / Increases government spending to increase demand
options.C: Tax kam kar deta hai / Decreases taxes
options.D: Money supply badhata hai / Increases money supply

question: Stagflation ke dauran kya hota hai? / What happens during stagflation?

options.A: Muddra-sfiti badhti hai aur berozgari bhi badhti hai / Inflation and unemployment both increase
options.B: Keemat girti hai aur rozgar badhta hai / Prices fall and employment rises
options.C: GDP tez badhta hai / GDP grows rapidly

question: Real GDP aur Nominal GDP ke beech ka farq kya hai? / What is the difference between Real GDP and Nominal GDP?

options.A: Real GDP moolya vriddhi se mukt hota hai / Real GDP is adjusted for inflation
options.B: Nominal GDP moolya vriddhi se mukt hota hai / Nominal GDP is adjusted for inflation
options.C: Dono mein koi fark nahi hai / There is no difference
options.D: Nominal GDP sirf government kharch ko dikhata hai / Nominal GDP shows only government spending

question: CPI aur WPI mein kya farq hai? / What is the difference between CPI and WPI?

options.A: CPI grahak ke nazariye se moolya sudhar ko maapta hai / CPI measures price changes from consumer perspective
options.B: WPI utpadakon ke nazariye se maapta hai / WPI measures from producer perspective
options.C: Dono ek hi cheez hai / Both are same
options.D: CPI me krishi samagri shamil nahi hoti / Agricultural products are not included in CPI

question: MPC (Marginal Propensity to Consume) aur MPS (Marginal Propensity to Save) ka yog kya hota hai? / What is the sum of MPC and MPS?

options.C: Depends on income

question: GDP growth rate ko badhane ke liye kaun si niti prabhavi hoti hai? / Which policy is effective to increase GDP growth rate?

options.A: Expansionary fiscal policy
options.B: Contractionary monetary policy
options.C: Deflationary policy

question: Inflation ke samay RBI kya kar sakta hai? / What can RBI do during inflation?

options.A: Repo rate badhakar mudra supply kam kare / Increase repo rate to reduce money supply
options.B: Repo rate kam karke mudra supply badhaye / Decrease repo rate to increase money supply
options.C: Sarkari kharch badhaye / Increase government spending

question: Deflation ka kaun sa prabhav sabse adhik dekha jata hai? / Which effect of deflation is most commonly seen?

options.A: Consumer spending mein girawat / Decline in consumer spending
options.B: Berozgari mein girawat / Decline in unemployment
options.C: GDP mein vriddhi / Growth in GDP
options.D: Udyogik utpadan mein vriddhi / Increase in industrial production

question: National Income ko factor cost par maapne ka kya arth hai? / What is the meaning of measuring National Income at factor cost?

options.A: Sarkari kar aur subsidy hata kar / Excluding taxes and adding subsidies
options.B: Market price par maapna / Measuring at market price
options.C: Sirf private sector ko include karna / Including only private sector
options.D: Sirf public sector ko include karna / Including only public sector

question: Inflation control ke liye 'Monetary Policy' ke kaun se tools hote hain? / What are the tools of Monetary Policy to control inflation?

options.A: Repo rate badhana
options.B: Cash reserve ratio (CRR) badhana
options.C: Open market operations (OMO)

question: Stagflation ke dauran sarkar kis tarah ki niti apna sakti hai? / What kind of policy can government adopt during stagflation?

options.A: Supply-side reforms
options.B: Demand-side expansion
options.C: High subsidies dena

question: India ki GDP mein sabse bada yogdaan kaunsa kshetra deta hai? / Which sector contributes most to India’s GDP?

options.A: Services sector
options.B: Agriculture sector
options.C: Manufacturing sector

question: Deflation ki sthiti kab ho sakti hai? / When can deflation occur?

options.A: Demand girne par
options.B: Supply girne par
options.C: Money supply badhne par

question: GDP par inflation ka prabhav kya hota hai? / What is the impact of inflation on GDP?

options.A: Nominal GDP badhta hai, lekin Real GDP prabhavit nahi hota / Nominal GDP increases, but Real GDP unaffected
options.B: Real GDP badhta hai, Nominal GDP nahi badhta / Real GDP increases, Nominal GDP does not
options.C: Dono badhte hain barabar / Both increase equally
options.D: Dono kam hote hain / Both decrease

question: GNP ko kaise badhaya ja sakta hai? / How can GNP be increased?

options.A: Foreign investment badha kar
options.B: Desh ke nagrikon ki kamai badha kar
options.C: Imports badha kar

question: 2024-25 mein Bharat ki mudra-sfiti ko kis factor se sabse adhik prabhavit hone ki sambhavana hai? / What factor is likely to influence India’s inflation most in 2024-25?

options.A: Fuel prices
options.B: Agricultural output
options.C: Global supply chain disruptions

question: National Income ki ginti mein kaun kaun se components shamil hote hain? / Which components are included in National Income calculation?

options.A: Wages and salaries
options.B: Rent and interest
options.C: Corporate profits
